group_description: The five basic short vowel sounds
pattern_rule: One vowel in closed syllable = short sound
teaching_strategy: Use hand gestures for mouth positions
visual_cue: ğŸ”´ Red cards for short sounds

group_description: Vowels that say their letter names
pattern_rule: Magic E or vowel teams = long sound
teaching_strategy: Stretch hand out for long sounds
visual_cue: ğŸ”µ Blue cards for long sounds

group_description: Vowels changed by the R sound

pattern_rule: Mouth moves from one position to another
visual_cue: ğŸŸ¡ Yellow cards for sliding sounds

pattern_rule: No vocal cord vibration + puff of air
Continuous air flow with no voice

group_description: Sounds that go through the nose
pattern_rule: Air flows through nose while humming
Tongue moves but doesn't block air
Start with vowel shape then glide

group_description: Tongue tip to gum ridge sounds

pattern_rule: Back of tongue touches soft palate
Tongue moves from high to low in front
Tongue moves from high to low in back
Tongue close to roof of mouth

teaching_strategy: Hand on throat for voice check

group_description: Words different by one sound only
teaching_strategy: Show one finger for one change

group_description: Letters you see but don't hear
teaching_strategy: Cover eye = can't see, cover ear = can't hear
